summary: An email from an FBI Special Agent in the New York Field Office to an unnamed recipient (likely another FBI agent) regarding the Maxwell/Epstein case. The sender is requesting to schedule a call to discuss discovery deadlines and ensure no lingering case information exists, referencing the initial investigation and the Rodriguez investigation.

persons.name: Special Agent FBI New York Field Office Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking
persons.context: The sender of the email, who is reaching out to schedule a discovery call regarding the Maxwell/Epstein case and the Rodriguez investigation.

persons.name: AUSAs
persons.context: The prosecutors who asked the email sender to reach out to schedule a call to discuss the Maxwell/Epstein case.

connections.person1: Special Agent FBI New York Field Office Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking
connections.description: Both are FBI agents, with the sender reaching out to the recipient for a case-related call.

connections.person1: Special Agent FBI New York Field Office Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking
connections.description: The AUSAs asked the FBI agent to contact MM regarding the Maxwell/Epstein case discovery.
The AUSAs want to schedule a call with MM to discuss case information.

events.title: Discovery deadline email
events.description: An FBI agent emails a colleague to schedule a call regarding approaching discovery deadlines in the Maxwell/Epstein case.
personsInvolved: Special Agent FBI New York Field Office Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking

keyFacts: The email indicates ongoing legal proceedings in the Maxwell/Epstein case as of October 2020, with approaching discovery deadlines.
The recipient (MM) worked on both the initial Epstein investigation and a subsequent 'Rodriguez investigation'.
Assistant U.S. Attorneys (AUSAs) are actively involved and seeking to ensure no lingering case information exists.
The communication is between FBI personnel in the Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit.
